Expectation1: Maintain a safe and O39ean work environment.
Situation1: You notice a small, contained liquid spill in a walkway that needs to be O39eaned up immediately to prevent slips.
Situation2: They have been scheduled to chant a portion during the service.
Story: I was sweeping up debris near the scaffolding when I noticed a slick, oily puddle spreading across the walkway. My supervisor always says safety comes first—any spill, no matter how small, has to be cleaned up right away. I reached for the mop, but my phone buzzed. It was a reminder: I was scheduled to chant Torah at synagogue in less than an hour. Missing my turn wasn’t an option; the community counted on me, and I’d promised my father I’d never let them down. But if I left now, someone could slip and get hurt, and I’d be letting my crew down too. My hands shook as I weighed the mop in one and my prayer book in the other, heart pounding with the pressure of two worlds pulling me in opposite directions.
